name: Upright Row with Dumbbells
how_to_perform:
1. Stand or sit with your back straight and engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine.

2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your thighs. Your grip should be comfortable and consistent throughout the exercise.

3. Bend down slightly to let your arms hinge at a 10-20 degree angle between your chest and your hands. Keep your back straight and engage your core as mentioned earlier.

4. Allow yourself to lean forward very slightly as you begin to draw the dumbbells towards your rib cage, keeping them close to your body throughout.

5. Maintain control over the weight as it approaches its natural stopping point close to the top of the movement (around chest height). Squeeze the muscles in your shoulders and trapezius.

6. Slowly reverse the motion by letting the dumbbells descend back down to the starting position, keeping them close to your body as you do so.

7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining control over the movement throughout.
short_summary: An upper body exercise using dumbbells that targets primarily the trapezius, rhomboids, and deltoid muscles, with additional emphasis on the core engaging throughout.
